title: Heavily nerf Chalice, Remove DFG, then gut her Early Game & her scaling stun
body:
Please understand.  **I dislike Syndra being so oppressive.**

But I have to admit.

I honestly feel sorry for Syndra mains.  3 Heavy hits in a row. {{champion:134}} 

Oh well.  Goodluck with Zed.  After giving you 3 heavy nerfs, **including removing your lane-bully status, which was the reason people played you, removing the item that contributed the most to your single-target burst, and making your sustained damage unreliable due to much less mana regen,** *at least they're talking about potentially tapping Zed's splitpushing in a future patch.*

:^)

...


:^(

> I'm glad her stun requires skill to land now.
> 
> But it also means less reliable AoE stunning, which makes her scaling-strength much weaker.
> 
> That would be fine because of her lane-bully status.  Except that they heavily nerfed mana regen AND lowered her early q to about auto-attack strength.
> So your late game is weaker.  Your early game strength - which is your identity as a Syndra - is much, much, MUCH weaker.  (Use q for weak poke, or use it for weak waveclear, both of which are much more difficult due to going OoM quickly now.)
> 
> And then her mid game 100-0 burst potential is hit by the DFG removal.
> 
> That's her early game, mid game, AND late game hit.  Hard.
>
> Her winrate has taken a skydive to the bottom 3, I've heard.  And DFG hasn't even been removed yet, has it?

Oh, and don't forget that, just to kick mages while they're down, Riot nerfed blue buff AND made the jungle tough enough that junglers need to keep it from mages more often than ever before.

Why is season 5 the anti-mage season, Riot?

The Q nerf was unnecessary and uncalled for. If Riot wanted to tone down Syndra they should have waited on Q to see how much of an impact her E changes made. Then seen how much of an impact removing DFG makes. Then maybe look into her Q, but that almost certainly wouldn't have been necessary.

Make a change, test results, proceed from there. This is really elementary but apparently too complex for the interns at Riot.

Which is kinda ironic since the best build on him is {{item:1056}} (x2) into {{item:3151}} into {{item:3116}} anyway. But in the event you went for {{item:3114}} Forbidden Idol in lane, you're getting a tiny bit more out of it that the other mages (which translates to: It sucks a tiny bit less on you).
